clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Postoperative Cognitive Decline in Aged Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Postoperative Cognitive Decline and Cytokines in Elderly Patients

brief_summary.textblock: postoperative cognitive decline is a common and deleterious complication in aged patients.The link between inflammation and postoperative cognitive decline has also been reported.However,the link between SOD1，SOD2，Osteopontin， Kallikrein-6，and Contactin-1 and postoperative cognitive decline is unknown. In this project ,investigators examine the relationship between 5 cytokines measured at there timepoints (preoperative [PREOP], postoperative day 1 [POD1] , and postoperative day 3[POD2]) and postoperative cognitive decline among older adults undergoing orthopedic surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who are more than 65 years old
- patients who undergo orthopedic surgery(trauma ,especially fracture of lower limb)
- patients with ASA physical status I-III
- patients who have a consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who are more than 85 years old
- patients with ASA physical status >III
- patients who have neurological disorders, stroke or other affective central nervous system diseases
- patients who have a history of serious psychiatric illness
- patients with long-term use of psychoactive substances
- patients who undergo multiple trauma and the presence of head injury
